metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14225 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The av_color_primaries_name function in libavutil/pixdesc.c in FFmpeg 3.3.3may return a NULL pointer depending on a value contained in a file, butcallers do not anticipate this, as demonstrated by the avcodec_stringfunction in libavcodec/utils.c, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. (Itis also conceivable that there is security relevance for a NULL pointerdereference in av_color_primaries_name calls within the ffprobecommand-line program.)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.14-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
